message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.DC 

This paper deals with the joint optimization of multicast beamforming and content-centric BS clustering in a cloud RAN with finite-capacity backhaul links and caches. It involves wireless communication, network optimization, and caching, which are relevant to the following arXiv CS sub-categories: 

- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): This sub-category covers topics related to network architecture, protocols, algorithms, and performance evaluation, which are all relevant to the proposed content-centric multicast transmission in a cloud RAN. 
- cs.IT (Information Theory): This sub-category deals with the fundamental limits and coding schemes for information transmission and storage, which are relevant to the optimization of transmission power and backhaul cost in the proposed system. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): This sub-category covers topics related to the modeling, analysis, and control of complex systems, which are relevant to the joint design of multicast beamforming and BS clustering in the proposed system. 
- cs.MM (Multimedia): This sub-category deals with the processing, analysis, and transmission of multimedia data, which are relevant to the content-centric caching and transmission in the proposed system. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): This sub-category covers topics related to the design, analysis, and optimization of distributed computing systems, which are relevant to the cloud RAN architecture and the joint optimization of multicast beamforming and
